column1: The river Adurant was the southernmost of the seven rivers of Ossiriand marking its southern boundary.  It ran from the southern Ered Luin into the river Gelion
column2: marking the southern boundary of Ossiriand. Halfway along its course the river divided and later rejoined
column3: forming the island of Tol Galen.

column1: The name means Doublestream (from adu "double" and rant "course") in Sindarin
column2: referring to a parting of the river about the isle of Tol Galen.
